newsitem.title: UK: SQUASH-JANSHER KHAN BANNED AND FINED.
newsitem.headline: SQUASH-JANSHER KHAN BANNED AND FINED.

text.p: World champion Jansher Khan has
been fined 1,000 pounds ($1,600) and banned for a month for late
withdrawal from last month's Mahindra International in Bombay,
the Professional Squash Association said on Wednesday.
It is the first time the Pakistani world number one has been
banned by the PSA since joining the tour as a teenager in 1987,
although he was fined for lack of effort in a Stuttgart event in
The 27-year-old , whose ban will start from the day he pays
his fine, has refused to play in the Mahindra event through its
four years as one of the leading tournaments on the PSA tour,
insisting that his safety as a high-profile Muslim Pakistani
sportsman in a mainly Hindu Indian city could not be guaranteed.
Last year, he had a change of heart only to revert to his
original position on the advice of the Pakistani Squash
Federation.
But the PSA said on Wednesday they could find "no credible
evidence" to substantiate Jansher's claims of threats to his
safety.
"We treat this a very serious issue," said John Nimick, the
PSA executive director. "Without the ability to guarantee to a
PSA tournament the participation of duly entered players, the
contract between events and the players is significantly
devalued."
